abstract: Big banks in Britain, Germany and France could gain an edge as their Wall Street counterparts move out of derivatives, proprietary trading and hedge funds, a report says.
snippet: Big banks in Britain, Germany and France could gain an edge as their Wall Street counterparts move out of derivatives, proprietary trading and hedge funds, a report says.
lead_paragraph: New financial regulations emerging from Washington could increase the bottom lines of some banks — just not banks on Wall Street.

headline.main: JPMorgan Says Dodd-Frank Favors Europe’s Banks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

abstract: James B. Lee, JPMorgan Chase’s vice chairman, discusses what chief executives are planning to do with corporations’ big cash hoards. He also talks about the trends influencing deals in this CNBC video.
snippet: James B. Lee, JPMorgan Chase’s vice chairman, discusses what chief executives are planning to do with corporations’ big cash hoards. He also talks about the trends influencing deals in this CNBC video.
lead_paragraph: James B. Lee, JPMorgan Chase’s vice chairman, discusses what chief executives are planning to do with corporations’ big cash hoards in this CNBC video. The investment banker also talks about the trends influencing deals, as seen in the General Motors I.P.O., which he handled.

headline.main: JPMorgan Chase’s Jimmy Lee on Deal Trends
